item.title: Choo, choo, Graeme is 2!
item.dc:creator: Cara Harrington
item.content:encoded:
Today Graeme turns 2.  He has quickly grown into an adventurous little boy who loves trains, balls, anything with wheels, and his mommy (much to daddy’s dismay at times).  He is sweet at times, aggressive at others, but always determined. Some stats on Graeme today:

Favorite songs: Thomas theme song, Itsy Bitsy Spider, ABCs
He’s heavier than Maggie was at this age, weighing in at 28lbs, but the same heigh at 34 inches. 
His vocabulary has been bursting in recent weeks – everything from “train table” to “Graeme do” to “Happy daddy day” for Father’s day to “Clay Buchholz” (when Pat asks who threw a no hitter!)

With our recent move, things have been hectic in Graeme’s life and he’s taken it all like a champ – new house, new bedroom, new school – all done without much fuss. He’s proven to be an easily adaptable kid – as long as there’s trains to distract him! We had a little party with some of his friends/cousins – of course, as it goes with 2nd children, only took a few photos!

 

 

video: Happy Birthday, Graeme!

item.title: New beginnings.
item.dc:creator: Cara Harrington
item.content:encoded:
Today marks a new beginning for our family – we sold our first home, the home we brought two beautiful babies home to, and are moving to our forever home. Our new house in Arlington is everything we dreamed of – lots of space, a quiet street, yard space.  While we are sad to be leaving Brighton and our neighborhood – especially the close proximity to some of our dearest friends – I know there is so much to look forward to at the new house.  Onward and upward!

Packing up

Saying goodbye

 

Welcome Home!

item.title: London calling
item.dc:creator: Cara Harrington
item.content:encoded:
Monday we returned home from 10 days in the UK.  We stayed with my Great Aunt Bernie and Great Uncle Jim at their lovely house in Kent, Treetop.  Both kids loved exploring the place, and Maggie enjoyed being able to have private art lessons courtesy of Jim.  I have many fond memories of visiting Treetop as a child, and hope Maggie and Graeme will too! We were able to do some day trips, despite a variety of illnesses that struck down each one of us at some stage! While traveling with kids definitely had it’s struggles (note: the enclosed capsules of the London Eye are not ideal for a screaming 14 month old….), I think we all enjoyed being in England, and I’m sure to be fielding many questions for when we’ll be returning – especially as Maggie has already asked about when we’ll see baby Alexa again!

And we’re off!

London
We took the train up to the city twice, the first time to visit with Rachel and her family, and Gemma and her family, and the second time to tick off items on Maggie’s bucket list: ride the top of a double decker bus, see Big Ben, go on the London Eye, and see Peter Pan.

                   

Hever Castle
Maggie also wanted to “see a real Queen’s castle”.

    

Rochester
First photo was taken by Maggie – nice to have a budding photographer in the family!

       

Kew Gardens
Not many photos – but beautiful park with a treetop walkway the kids loved and a fantastic playground.

Treetop
The real highlight of the trip was the time spent with family – the kids meeting their great, great aunt and uncle, us getting to meet baby Lexie, and lots of time spent just catching up!

item.title: A very colorful 4th birthday
item.dc:creator: Cara Harrington
item.content:encoded: Today we celebrated Maggie’s 4th birthday with LOTS of rainbows!  Thankfully, despite a forecast all week of rain, it held off and we were able to enjoy an evening of fun, friends, and cake!

item.title: Happy happy birthday, Graeme!
item.dc:creator: Cara Harrington
item.content:encoded:
And in the blink of an eye, Graeme has turned 1.

Our littlest has turned from a wrinkled little baby to a fearless, energetic, joyful toddler. Still in love with his big sister, Graeme tries his hardest to keep up with her, and it won’t be long until he does!  He’s days away from officially being a walker (has done up to 10 steps so far), attacks challenges with full force, and has a stubborn determination.  Some tidbits on Graeme today:

Teeth: 3 up top, 3 on the bottom
Favorite sayings: Ah and Da
Preferred language: Spanish (thank you Nuvia!)
Loves: all things with wheels, any protein-based foods, dancing to music, his best friend Mikey.
Personality: busy, stubborn, loving, and silly

We celebrated his birthday with family and friends, and the love and superpowers were in full force!

item.title: End of Pre-K…
item.dc:creator: Cara Harrington
item.content:encoded:
Maggie had her end of year performance at St. Col’s – warning: cuteness overload! Enjoy!

With a little help from my friends

Inch by Inch

item.title: Another holiday season in the books
item.dc:creator: Cara Harrington
item.content:encoded: We celebrated Graeme’s 1st and Maggie’s 4th Christmas with no shortage of candy canes, caroling, and cheer! Maggie was really into Christmas this year and it made everything all the more exciting – from writing her list, to shopping for her brother and daddy, to posing for the holiday card photo, she did it all with a smile on her face and a skip in her step.  We got to meet Santa, see the Nutcracker her dance school put on, decorate gingerbread houses, and see lots of family and friends – while it’s always sad when the holidays are over, ours were so jam-packed that I’m looking forward to a quiet January!

item.title: Why I’m With Her.
item.dc:creator: Cara Harrington
item.content:encoded:
Ahead of Tuesday’s election, I want to get this out.  I know this blog doesn’t get much traffic, but I hope one day when Maggie and Graeme are older, they appreciate the photos and posts to tell them about our life (printed photo albums are far too hard to keep up with, and that baby book I never filled in…yea…).  So for them, and all the kids out there who are too young to vote but who’s lives will be forever affected by the results of this election, here’s why I’m with Hillary.

I’m with her…because raising human beings is hard enough without having to explain why our president is allowed to name call.

I’m with her…because parents deserve to have paid leave to take care of a new baby, an aging parent, or a sick kid.

I’m with her…because immigrants make our country a better place and should be welcomed with open arms.

I’m with her…because getting sick should not put you into bankruptcy.

I’m with her…because women deserve the right to makes their own decisions about their own bodies.

I’m with her…because we need Supreme Court justices who will continue to protect the lives and interests of women, minorities, LGBTQ, and other under-represented populations.

I’m with her…because education is one of the most important things we can give the next generation, and we need to do better.

I’m with her…because I’m an ally who believes that you should be able to love whoever you want, be whoever you want, and live the life you choose.

I’m with her…because women work just as hard (sometimes harder) than their male counterparts and should be compensated equally.

I’m with her…because my vision of America is a united one, one where our differences raise us up rather than tearing us apart.

I’m with her…because I believe in science, climate change is real, and we need to power our lives in ways that are more efficient, effective, and better for the environment.

I’m with her…because she is the MOST qualified person to ever run for office and will continue to push our country forward.

I’m with her…because “Madam President” should be a term used so frequently, it’s no longer novel.

I’m with her…because not just our daughters, but our sons, need to live in a country where a woman can rise to the highest office to show them that women can and should do whatever they want in life.

I’m with her…because LOVE should always trump hate.

item.title: Halloween 2016
item.dc:creator: Cara Harrington
item.content:encoded: We found lots of opportunities to dress up this Halloween season – Boo at the Stone Zoo with the Fourniers, Trunk or Treat at St. Col’s with cousins, and Trick or Treating with the Morgans.

item.title: Pregnancy and Infant Loss Awareness Month
item.dc:creator: Cara Harrington
item.content:encoded:
Since 1988, October has been Pregnancy and Infant Loss Awareness Month – I never really gave it much thought, both the getting pregnant and full pregnancy with Maggie had gone as smoothly as we could hope (until the final weeks at least!) that I wasn’t worried. Then came spring 2015. We had decided it was about time for #2 and once again, I got pregnant. A trip to my OB confirmed things and we began the planning…will we find out the gender? how will Maggie adjust? We’ll need to clear out the office…

Soon it was time for my next check up with my OB, around 9 weeks when we should be able to hear the heartbeat for the first time. Sadly, there wasn’t one. A quick scan confirmed that the baby had stopped growing 2 weeks prior. The next few days were a blur as we had a D&C and attempted to process the news.

Unfortunately, my story is not unique, but when it first happened, it felt that way. As I shared my news with close friends and family, I quickly realized how common it can be, though not often talked about. I’m sharing this now, having had plenty of time to grieve and having made it through my subsequent pregnancy, to let others know – you’re not alone. It’s a horrible thing to experience, but there’s light on the other side.

So while there will always be some amount of “what if’s”, looking at Graeme now, I can’t imagine life without him.  I do believe that some things happen for a reason, and luckily, I have two beautiful, healthy kids to remember that rainbows only come after the rain.
